  • data BinaryLTL = Until

    • | Plus (Prog p) (Prog p)
    • | Comp (Prog p) (Prog p)
    • | Star (Prog p)

Documentation

data PropLogic p u b Source

PropLogic is a data type for logics based on propositional logic- particularly modal logics.

Constructors

PropConst Bool 
PropVar p 
Not (PropLogic p u b) 
And (PropLogic p u b) (PropLogic p u b) 
Or (PropLogic p u b) (PropLogic p u b) 
Unary u (PropLogic p u b) 
Binary b (PropLogic p u b) (PropLogic p u b) 

Instances

DrawableWithName (BasicPropLogic q)

Lets me draw a graph of a boolean formula, named to distinguish it from other graphs

(Show q, Show a, Ord q, Ord a) => Drawable (Map (q, a) (BasicPropLogic q))

Drawing boolean formulas from transition table

(Eq p, Eq u, Eq b) => Eq (PropLogic p u b) 
(Ord p, Ord u, Ord b) => Ord (PropLogic p u b) 
(Show p, Show u, Show b) => Show (PropLogic p u b) 

foldLog :: (Bool -> r) -> (p -> r) -> (r -> r) -> (r -> r -> r) -> (r -> r -> r) -> (u -> r -> r) -> (b -> r -> r -> r) -> PropLogic p u b -> rSource

mapLog :: (Bool -> Bool) -> (p -> q) -> PropLogic p u b -> PropLogic q u bSource

type LTLogic p = PropLogic p UnaryLTL BinaryLTLSource

type LDLogic p = PropLogic p (Prog p) VoidSource

data Prog p Source

Constructors

Test (LDLogic p) 
Plus (Prog p) (Prog p)

Instances

Show p => Show (Prog p) 

foldProg :: (BasicPropLogic p -> r) -> (LDLogic p -> r) -> (r -> r -> r) -> (r -> r -> r) -> (r -> r) -> Prog p -> rSource

trueProg :: Prog pSource

diamond :: Prog p -> LDLogic p -> LDLogic pSource

diamond p is a unary modality that transforms LDL formulae. e.g. true f where f is an LDL formula, is diamond true f. square is its dual.

square :: Prog p -> LDLogic p -> LDLogic pSource

ltl2ldl :: LTLogic p -> LDLogic pSource
